record.jsxtip: The CDF attribute to sort records on. If this attribute is not provided, the select entries are rendered in the order that they appear in the CDF document.
The sort direction if the jsxsortpath attribute is provided. Either 'ascending' or 'descending'.
The sort data type if the jsxsortpath attribute is provided. Either 'text' or 'number'.
If 'yes' then the jsxtext attribute of each CDF record is rendered without escaping XML characters.

The jsxid attribute of the CDF record whose child records are rendered as the entries in the select. If provided, only the direct children of the record are rendered. If this attribute is not provided, all descendants of the root data element are rendered.
If equal to 1, the type-ahead feature of this combo control is case-sensitive.

Overrides the default localized list of lowercase characters used if this combo control is not case sensitive. Before a comparison all lowercase characters are converted to their corresponding uppercase character.
Overrides the default localized list of uppercase characters used if this combo control is not case sensitive.
If equal to 1, no check is displayed next to the selected record in the dropdown.
If '0', the jsximg CDF attribute is not resolved as a URL.
The title of the content of the select drop-down for use in loading, error, and timeout messages.
